speaker: Frasier
text: Look at this!  My so called "wind proof" umbrella.  _He struggles to close the umbrella but, failing, throws it away on the floor in the corridor._

speaker: Frasier
text: I might as well use one of those little paper ones they put in Polynesian drinks!

speaker: Roz
text: I've got a big collection of those; they remind me of wonderful evenings that I can't remember.  You know, I've got some requests here for some personal appearances. City College wants you to lecture...

speaker: Frasier
text: Fine, just tell me the date.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay.  St. Bartholomew's Hospital wants you to emcee their annual benefit.

speaker: Frasier
text: Pass.

speaker: Roz
text: What, you're turning down a hospital?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_without even looking at Roz_] Don't look at me that way.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, I'm with you, I hate the way those whiny sick people are always nagging you for things.  "I want a magazine, I want a kidney!"

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, I have as much sympathy for sick people as you do, which is why I said yes when they asked me to appear last year. I bought an Armani tuxedo, spent a week working on my speech, postponed a trip to go see Frederick; then on the morning of the dinner they called me, told me they didn't need me because their first choice had become available: the irrepressible Kathie Lee Gifford!

speaker: Roz
text: God, way to hold a grudge!

speaker: Frasier
text: This is not about spite.  This is about dignity.  Dignity is a rare and fragile thing.  Any other requests?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, the Teenage Seattle pageant wants you to be a judge.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'll do that.

speaker: Roz
text: [_looks at him_] That's real dignified!

speaker: Frasier
text: A scholarship is involved!

speaker: Roz
text: Right.  You're on in ten seconds.  We have new sponsors and the sales department wants you to work this copy in as often as you can.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good Afternoon, Seattle. This is Dr. Frasier Crane, KACL 780. Well, it's another gray, depressing day here in the Emerald City.  Here's hoping we can brighten up your afternoon.  We hold it our personal duty to banish your rainy day blues. But first a message from our sponsors. [_reads paper_] "Death is inevitable."

speaker: Frasier
text: "But it's especially painful when it claims a beloved family pet.  If you've lost, or are planning to lose, a cherished dog, cat or bird, let Pet Paradise console you with a tasteful Plexiglas memorial bearing the likeness of your departed friend.  Pet Paradise - �though your pet may be small, your loss is great.'" [_puts down sheet_] Who's our first caller, Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: We have Edna on line two, she's a receptionist at a pest control company and she's feeling depressed.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Edna, I'm listening.

speaker: Edna
text: [_v.o_] Hello, Dr. Crane.  I've been working at pest control for fifteen years.  I go in every day, answer the same calls, ask the same questions.  "What kind of bugs are they?" "Have you seen any droppings?"  Then I go to the next person.  "What kind of bugs are they?"  "Have you seen any droppings?"

speaker: Frasier
text: Edna, I'm a psychiatrist, I can sense where this is going. Now, even the most interesting of lives can become routine. What you need to do is shake up your world, find a new boyfriend, a new job, a new city even.

speaker: Edna
text: You mean move?

speaker: Frasier
text: Certainly there are far easier places to cheer up than this dreary, soggy old city of ours.

speaker: Edna
text: You know something, Dr. Crane, you're right.  I don't have to stay here.  When you think about it, there's a whole world of vermin out there!

speaker: Frasier
text: Very eloquently put, Edna.  Thank you for your call.

speaker: Frasier
text: Speaking of vermin... [_reads_] "When that special rat of yours turns his little toes up for the last time, don't forget your friends at Pet Paradise.  Pet Paradise -- �when a shoe box isn't enough.'"  _Frasier rolls his eyes.  FADE OUT_  **IT WILL BE THE WORLD'S FIRST FOUR LEGGED LEPRECHAUN**  _Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. The following morning, Martin is sat reading the paper with his breakfast as Frasier enters from his bedroom in a dressing gown. The weather outside suggests why the city was called SEA-ttle!_

speaker: Frasier
text: Another radiant morning!  Morning, dad.  Do I drive to work today or just hail a passing gondola?!

speaker: Martin
text: I like the rain, it chases those squeegee guys off the street.  _Daphne enters from the front door in her raincoat.  She has Eddie who is appropriately dressed in a bright yellow dog mackintosh._

speaker: Daphne
text: Now stay put until I can dry off your feet. _Frasier re-enters to see Eddie jump up onto the suede couch to rub his feet dry._

speaker: Frasier
text: There, that ought to do it!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Daphne, get that hat off him.  Isn't it bad enough we had him neutered?

speaker: Daphne
text: Look, by the way things are going, I don't think I'm going to have children.  Just let me dress up the dog!

speaker: Martin
text: I've never seen a dog look that stupid.

speaker: Daphne
text: You'll change your tune when you see the outfit I got him for St. Patrick's Day!

speaker: Martin
text: [_reading paper_] Hey, get a load of this.  Derek Mann mentioned you in his column.  "I've been listening to Frasier Crane this week because I've been trying to drop a few pounds; I find his voice makes an effective appetite suppressant!"

speaker: Frasier
text: [_dry_] How witty!

speaker: Martin
text: [_serious_] I thought so too. [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Give me that! [_takes paper_] "Yesterday, I heard him advise an unhappy young woman that she could magically cure her depression simply by leaving Seattle.  I know it would cure my depression if the Seattle-hating Dr. Crane would take his own advice and leave town as soon as possible!" [_folds paper_] It's just ludicrous, I never said any such thing!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, yes, you did.  I heard you.  You said Seattle was dreary and if she wanted to spruce up her life, she should leave town.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that was just one of several suggestions I made. He took that completely out of context.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, whatever you said, you're gonna apologize, right?

speaker: Frasier
text: What for?

speaker: Martin
text: For insulting Seattle!  People round here take a lot of pride in this town, they don't appreciate some radio know-it-all telling them it's rainy and depressing.

speaker: Frasier
text: In case you haven't noticed, Dad, it does get a little damp around here!  For God's sake, the state flower is Mildew!

speaker: Martin
text: Let me tell you something: a city's like a woman.  You get one mad at you, it doesn't matter if you're completely right and she's completely wrong, you'll apologize anyway, or you'll be paying for it for the rest of your life!

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm not sure I care for that analogy.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, gee, I'm sorry, Daphne, I was way out of line.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_smiles_] All right, you're forgiven.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Dad, to you, everything is like a woman.  A fast car is like a woman, a romantic song is like a woman, good meatloaf is like a woman.  Well, a city is not like a woman, it's like a city and I am not apologizing to this one. Even if you won't understand that, Seattle does!  And Seattle loves Frasier Crane! _Frasier goes to the window and looks out over the city only to have thunder and lightning as his response before he exits to his room.  FADE TO:  Scene Three - Radio Station. Father Mike is using the vending machine as Frasier enters with another blown-out umbrella.  He again fails to shut it and throws it into another booth._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Father Mike.

speaker: Mike
text: Hello, Frasier.

speaker: Roz
text: Look, Dr. Crane was not bashing Seattle, he was sincerely trying to help that woman!  Who's our sponsor?  Pet Paradise. Well fine, go ahead and boycott them - see how easy it is to flush your dead German Shepherd down the toilet! [_hangs up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't tell me, was that a complaint about this rain business?

speaker: Roz
text: Yes and thanks to you I've been on the phone all morning.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, forgive me.  From now on I'll stick to subjects like suicide and birth control, stay away from the controversial stuff like weather! _The phone rings, which Roz answers.  As she listens to the caller, Bulldog enters._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, Doc.  I need some advice.  I feel a cold coming on and I'm wondering, should I take vitamin C or should I just leave Seattle?! [_laughs_]

speaker: Roz
text: [_hangs up_] I hope you're happy!  According to Betsy, the switchboard has logged over fifty irate calls!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Fifty?!  Damn, you topped my record!  The most I ever got was thirty-five when I said that commentary, "Lady Umpires - Finally a Chest Worth Protecting!"

speaker: Roz
text: You know, Frasier, you really should think about apologizing.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I'd be the first to apologize if I said anything wrong but I didn't.

speaker: Roz
text: I've got half a dozen calls stacked up in there, and they all said you did.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, just take messages from all those people -- I don't want to talk to them.

speaker: Roz
text: You know, I don't know how to break this to you... but it's a call-in show!  _Roz exits to her booth.  FADE TO:  Scene Four - Radio Station. Time has lapsed.  Frasier is listening to an irate caller (Connie). It seems Roz and Frasier have ordered Chinese take out._

speaker: Connie
text: [_v.o._] I don't know how you can say Seattle is a depressing place.  I spent the last forty years in this city working the graveyard shift at a cemetery!  And let me tell you something, you fat-headed moron: I am probably the most cheerful person you'll ever meet! [_hangs up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You're certainly the most cheerful I've met today! [_Roz mimes him to smile_] Alas, we're out of time.  I'd like to just say, as I've been saying for the last three hours, it was not my intent to cause anyone offense but since it seems obvious that I have, I would like to say this: I apologize.  [_Roz is happy_] I do not find Seattle a depressing place to live.  It would take more than clouds to obscure the beauty of her landscape and more than drizzle to dampen the warmth and good fellowship that makes Seattle the only place in this bad old world that I care to call home.  Till Monday then, this is Dr. Frasier Crane, signing off.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good grief!  Never in my life have I heard from such a bunch of whiny, provincial crybabies.  I swear to God, this entire city has lost it's tiny, rain-addled mind!  _Roz notices the "on air" light and rushes frantically to the microphone._

speaker: Roz
text: [_honeyed voice_] Dr. Crane, we're still on the air.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Roz. [_presses the button firmly_]

speaker: Roz
text: [_mad_] Now we're off! **LET A SMILE BE YOUR UMBRELLA**  _Scene Five - Frasier's Apartment. Daphne and Martin are watching as Niles fumbles around with a new television set._

speaker: Niles
text: This goes here and that attaches there!

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, are you sure you don't want me to try my hand there?

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, Daphne, this is no job for you.  You might crack a nail or snag a cuticle.  There, are we getting anything?

speaker: Martin
text: Does annoyed count?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, hush.  If you hadn't bashed it with your cane because your precious Seahawks lost, we wouldn't need a new set now, would we?  Isn't there a manual?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, but unfortunately Stephen Hawking is not here to explain it to us! _Frasier enters once again with a deranged umbrella.  This time he doesn't even bother trying to make sense of it and throws it out into the hallway._

speaker: Martin
text: God, I thought the winds had eased up out there!

speaker: Frasier
text: They have.

speaker: Daphne
text: Then what happened to your umbrella?

speaker: Frasier
text: One of my listeners recognized me on the street, he pulled it backwards through a chain link fence!  You would not believe the hostility I've encountered.  Even at the Cafe Nervosa, my sanctuary, I thought they were trying out the new cappuccino maker - I turned and saw three tables hissing at me!

speaker: Martin
text: Don't answer that, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: I can't abide the sound of a ringing phone.

speaker: Martin
text: It's just going to be another crank complaining about Frasier, they've been calling here all day!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, they've got my home number now?!

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, but, just because the phone rings doesn't mean we have to answer it.

speaker: Daphne
text: Even though it could be Frederick calling to say he loves you or Grammy Moon calling to say her hip's gone out again.

speaker: Daphne
text: Still, we can't be swayed by a little ringing bell.  Just because it's going ring... ring... ring.

speaker: Daphne
text: Or in the case of a British telephone; Ring-ring... ring- ring... ring-ring... ring-ring... ring-ring....

speaker: Frasier
text: Just answer it, for God's sake!

speaker: Daphne
text: Thank you!

speaker: Daphne
text: Crane residence.  Oh, no, I'm afraid he can't come to the phone, may I take a message? [_pause_] Oh, nice language that! I hope you don't eat with that mouth!

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, Daphne, excuse me. [_takes receiver and speaks into phone_] Now see here, how dare you speak to a lady that way. [_pause_] Yes, well, that's no excuse, ma'am!  Well, only a coward makes threats over the phone, I dare you to come here and say that to my face. [_fake laugh_] Never you mind where I live! [_hangs up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Is anyone expecting visitors?  Well, I suggest we all remain very, very quiet. _There's another knock which is responded to by Eddie's frantic barking. The rest stare at him._

speaker: Niles
text: I suddenly have this image of angry villagers wielding torches and pitchforks.

speaker: Roz
text: [_o.s_] Frasier, open up, it's Roz!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh dear, it's worse than I thought!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, what are you doing out on this ungodly night?

speaker: Roz
text: I tried calling but your line is busy.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Martin.  How are you doing?

speaker: Martin
text: Great.

speaker: Roz
text: Is that a new TV?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.

speaker: Roz
text: It looks great.  Did you get it hooked up yet?

speaker: Martin
text: No, I decided I'd let Niles take a crack at it first!

speaker: Roz
text: Martin you're awful. [_laughs_] Frasier, after you left, the station manager stopped by.  He's taking a lot of heat from the sponsors and he says if you cannot smooth this over, he may have to suspend you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Suspend me?  Well, what's he going to put in my timeslot?

speaker: Roz
text: He'd have to run "The Best Of Crane."

speaker: Martin
text: What will he do on the second day?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know how I'm ever going to smooth this over. The entire city is out to lynch me.

speaker: Roz
text: Tell me about it.  This guy I know at the gym cancelled on me when he found out I worked for you.  You've been alienating my boyfriends!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, we can't afford to lose a demographic as large as that!

speaker: Roz
text: Look, what we need here is a little damage control.  Now it's still not too late to call the people at St. Bart's hospital and tell them you'll speak at their fundraiser.

speaker: Frasier
text: After the way they treated me last year?

speaker: Roz
text: It's a big event, there'll be lots of media there, this is a perfect chance for you to redeem yourself.

speaker: Martin
text: Listen to Roz.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dad, just stay out of this!

speaker: Martin
text: [_already in it_] Why?  If you take my advice...

speaker: Frasier
text: I did take your advice, I apologized.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, so sincerely!

speaker: Roz
text: What is the big deal?  You'll make a few jokes, a few self- deprecating remarks, you'll be helping sick people and showing everyone you know how to laugh at yourself.

speaker: Niles
text: I think it's a brilliant suggestion.

speaker: Roz
text: My God, Niles, did you just compliment me?

speaker: Niles
text: Indeed I did.  You're very savvy, Roz.  You remind me of one of those cleverly amoral PR flacks who sell their services to industries that pollute!

speaker: Frasier
text: You really think it's a good idea, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, worked for Nancy Reagan. After her first year in the White House she was widely criticized for her lavish spending. She responding by appearing at a satirical dinner wearing cheap store clothes and performing "Secondhand Rose."

speaker: Daphne
text: And that made people like her again?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, briefly.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, what the hell.  Tell them I'll emcee.  You know, better yet, tell them I'll take a whole table at the banquet.

speaker: Roz
text: I already did. [_hands tickets_] You owe those nuns eight hundred bucks.

speaker: Frasier
text: Eight hundred...?

speaker: Roz
text: Don't mess with them!

speaker: Frasier
text: I've put myself in such a precarious position, I've got to choose my material very carefully.

speaker: Niles
text: Ooh, I know some good jokes.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Niles, you don't!

speaker: Roz
text: If it's jokes you need, feel free to use some of mine.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] I'm sure the nuns would just love that.  Why don't I call Bulldog and ask him for a couple of limericks from his Nantucket series?!  I'll just call Father Mike, I'm sure he knows a couple of inoffensive jokes. _Frasier goes to the phone to pick it up.  However, before he can it rings._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_into phone_] Hello?  Yes, well, you know, I don't care how you feel!  I want to use the phone right now! [_hangs up_] Daphne, your grandmother's hip was out again. _Daphne stands up in worry as Frasier calms her explaining he was just joking.  Daphne isn't amused._    **MAN OVERBOARD**  _Scene One - St. Bart's Annual Benefit Banquet Hall. Everyone is sat around tables in the hall.  Frasier is sat near the podium with a nun, Sister Joselia, from the hospital.  Martin, Roz, Niles and Daphne are sat around a table._ [_N.B. "Sister Joselia" is the name of a character from Joe Keenan's early novels, "Blue Heaven" and "Putting On The Ritz."_]

speaker: Joselia
text: I do hope you'll have some humorous stories for us. Though, of course, nothing too racy or risque.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, no, of course not, I wouldn't dream of it.

speaker: Joselia
text: Good.  Last year, Kathie Lee Gifford told the most unfortunate story involving newlyweds and a ski lift! _Frasier looks guilty and quickly pulls out his speech and makes some serious alterations.  Meanwhile, Father Mike joins the rest of the gang._

speaker: Mike
text: Hello, all.  Thank you for coming out for such a good cause.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, I'd support this cause anytime.  St. Bart's is where I had my hip surgery, they treated me good.

speaker: Mike
text: Oh, I just saw Frasier.  I must say, he seems a bit nervous.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, he ought to be, there's a lot riding on his performance tonight.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, thank goodness he's got that sweet old nun there to comfort him.

speaker: Martin
text: [_looks over_] She's not so sweet!  That's Sister Joselia, the scrubbing nun!  Better known as "The Terror of Ward Three"!  [_N.B. In Joe Keenan's novels, Sister Joselia's nickname is "The Mutilator."_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Do you remember her?

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, you know that nightmare where I wake up screaming, "Not the sponge!  Not the sponge!"

speaker: Roz
text: You know when I was a girl, I considered being a nun.

speaker: Mike
text: Really, what changed your mind?

speaker: Roz
text: [_grasping_] I didn't want to work weekends!

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, where did Maris go?

speaker: Mike
text: Well, I believe Mrs. Crane is over there. [_points her out_]

speaker: Niles
text: Where? [_notices_] Oh, bless her busy little heart, she's cornered Lydia Beaumont, head of the museum board.  Maris has been angling to get on that board for years.

speaker: Martin
text: It looks like Lydia's getting away.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes, the old freshen-the-drink ploy.  Poor old Lydia has no idea with whom she's dealing.  That's right, Maris, chug that sherry, on with the chase!  There she goes, she's gaining, she's gaining, she's coming round the ice sculpture; It's Mrs. Beaumont and Maris, Mrs. Beaumont and Maris, and... Yes!  They meet again!

speaker: Niles
text: I fully expect they'll be board mates before they clear away the desserts.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Dr. Crane, we were just saying how handsome and confident you were looking.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Niles
text: Absolutely! [_hands over a handkerchief_] Forehead.

speaker: Mike
text: Did you memorize those jokes I gave you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, they're the reason I look so handsome and confident.

speaker: Roz
text: Shouldn't they have started this thing by now?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, we're waiting for Bishop Cologie, he's supposed to be introducing me.

speaker: Mike
text: I'm sure he'll be here any minute.  Break a leg, Frasier.

speaker: Martin
text: Now, listen, I've done a few bolwing banquets in my time - the thing to remember is keep smiling and look like you're having a good time.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.

speaker: Martin
text: And if a joke bombs, don't pay any attention to it.  Do what Johnny Carson used to do - just make a joke about how bad it is. [_impression_] Hmmm?  Bomb-o!

speaker: Martin
text: I miss that guy!

speaker: Roz
text: Your dad's right, Frasier, just go up there and be confident.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, I'll do that just as soon as I find a men's room.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you'll be fine, you've just got a few butterflies in your stomach.

speaker: Frasier
text: Not for long, I won't.  I'll be right back.

speaker: Mike
text: Good evening, I'm Father Mike Mancuso and I've just been asked to make a very sad announcement.  As you now, every year, our guest speaker has been introduced by Bishop Cologie, our chairman and host of the popular Sunday morning cable TV show, "Pancakes and Parables."  However, we've just been informed that the Bishop has suffered a terrible accident. [_audience gasp_] It seems that he was out fishing this afternoon when his boat was hit by a storm and capsized.  At the moment he remains missing.  However, I will keep you abreast of any further developments.

speaker: Niles
text: Why does everything happen to Frasier?

speaker: Mike
text: But, fazed as you are, we know how much this evening means to the Bishop and how he delights in entertaining us each year with his biblical hand shadows.  We also know that he would be the first to insist that we proceed without him.  So, I'm going to step in and introduce this year's speaker.  Won't you extend a cordial, gracious welcome to my friend and colleague, Dr. Frasier Crane. [_Dr. Crane is nowhere to be seen_] Dr. Crane?  Dr. Crane? _Frasier enters from the bathroom, completely oblivious to Father Mike's speech._

speaker: Mike
text: Ah...

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Father Mike.  Thank you very much.  I can't tell you what a honor it is to be here this evening.  I expected the Bishop to introduce me but I'm sure he'll drift in eventually.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, it's a real comfort to see so many priests out there in the audience.  These days I don't dare speak in public without someone standing by who can perform the last rites. [_audience are appalled_] Whoa!  Very religious crowd, I see. I can tell because of the vow of silence! [_to a priest_] I hope you've got some holy water standing by there, father, I'm dying here.  And speaking of water!  That reminds me of a little story.  A Rabbi, a Minister and a Priest, are all sitting at the bar on the _Titanic_...

speaker: Joselia
text: Dr. Crane, the Bishop!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, I heard the story with a priest, but what the heck, a bishop's even funnier.  Thank you, Sister.  Okay, then, a Rabbi, a Minister and a Bishop are all sitting at the bar when the Purser rushes in to give them the horrible news.

speaker: Roz
text: [_stands in a plea_] Frasier, the Bishop is lost at sea!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hey, look, are you telling this story or am I?!

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier...

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on, lady, I work alone!  All right, hey, thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, anyway, so the Purser rushes in to give them the horrible news about the boat.  So, the Rabbi gets up and says, "My God, my people will need me."  The Minister's about to leave when the Priest said - oops, oh, sorry - the Bishop says, "Sit down, relax, have another drink.  I'm sure that the Rabbi can handle it."  And the Minister says, "My God, man!  How can you abandon your flock when we've just hit an iceberg?!"  And the Bishop says, "An iceberg?!  I thought he said we had no ice aboard!"

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello? [_taps microphone_] Is this thing on? [_imitating Johnny Carson_] Whoa!  Bomb-o! _At the table his family bury their heads.  End of Act Two_
